35m ago
I have 6 protect for about 4 years now. (3 of them have been replaces, 2 under warranty, one went to the bin)
I had a smoke alarm in the middle of the night again!! its a bug, just a bug, nothing shows up in the logs.
The only thing a can conclude is that this message is played together with the BATTERY check.
I was looking for another brand but fortunantly. the protect is the most capable sensor, slow burning detection, co detection, temperature increase fire detection, night light.
So after all, i stick to the protects, BUT i really miss the api to send commands to the rollers to open so we could escape in case of real danger. It would be stupid to have 2 alarms in the only escape way to have one that could send the emergency signal to our home automation system.
Maybe this all has a bit more side info but in my opinion this really could be a battery check that triggers emergency notifications. The 3 nests that where bought in the same box where a nighmare. 3 fire alarms when not home and 6 false battery check smoke notifications at night.
And then, last but not least... fire is a emergency notification. When i am not at home and one my doors are opening my android receives a notification by using pushover. There i can choose to use the emergency channel for the sound, bypassing the device volume and do not disturb setting. Very handy!
Why is google nest not using the google android emergency channel for fire or smoke push message trough the emergency channel?
Why not fix these issues and make more people buy these?
